title: Yungblud and Lewis Capaldi would 'get drunk five nights a week'
text:
The two became friends while they were both searching for a record deal (Picture: Getty Images/Rex)

Yungblud has revealed that he used to be flatmates with none other than Lewis Capaldi – and they would ‘cause so much trouble’ as they got ‘drunk five nights a week’.

The rising 22-year-old rocker has admitted to becoming very good pals with the Someone You Loved hitmaker, while the two were searching for a record deal.

‘Lewis was here in London trying to get signed like me,’ Yungblud told The Sun.

‘No one wanted to f*****g know, so we’d just be getting drunk five nights a week. We caused so much trouble.’

And Yungblud – real name Dominic Harrison – also added that he and Lewis still keep in contact to this day, as they wondered how they had come so far in their careers.

‘We still keep in contact. We were in America together and we were like, “What the f*** is going on?”,’ he said.

‘Now we’re like sat in Soho House saying, “How the f*** did we get here?”’

Although Yungblud has found himself a celebrity friend in the Scottish singer, he hasn’t got off to a good start with Oasis star Noel Gallagher – with Noel not having the nicest things to say to him at a celebrity party.

Yungblud didn’t get off to the best start with Noel Gallagher, however (Picture: Rex)

‘Me and Adam the guitar player snuck into a party,’ he explained. ‘Noel comes up to me and I’m like, “Hello Noel nice to meet you,” and he was like, “How the f*** did you get in here?” I was like, “You’ll know who I am soon”.’

However, he later added that Noel’s daughter, Anais, already knew who he was.

Lewis has also found himself a friend in Niall Horan (Picture: Rex)

He said: ‘I know his daughter Anais pretty well and when I last saw her, I asked: “Does your dad know who I am yet?” and she was like, “Of course he f*****g does”. It’s mad.’

Yungblud asides, Lewis has also found himself another famous friend in the form of Niall Horan – with the former One Direction member cheekingly admitting to ‘sliding into his DMs’.

‘We met on social media, I slide into his DMs,’ he revealed. ‘My cousin showed me his music online when he had a small amount of views on a Vevo video.’

While Lewis admitted that Niall reached out to him when his ‘music was doing f*** all’: ‘He was one of the first people to reach out and say, “love your music.”’
